summary:
Steel (and Ebony for the Dark version) based, skimpy, armor for the CBBEv3 curvy body.

This is the second armor I created after my Spearhead Catsuit.
Used what I had learned from the first atempt and made this which is technically
a far better model while I still lack texturing skills.
descriptionHtml:
Steel (and Ebony for the Dark version) based, skimpy, armor for the CBBEv3 body.
(Pictures can do most of the talking :)

This is the second armor I created after my Spearhead Catsuit.
Used what I had learned from the first atempt and made this which is technically
a far better model while I still lack texturing skills.

This supports both weight 0 and 1 which the Spearhead Catsuit don't.



Important notes:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Based off the CBBE v3 body curvy [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?](http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?)[/url]
Weight 0 and 1 support but no bounce or extra bones support.
Not lore friendly (If you don't like it, don't use it) !
For the heeled boots you need SKSE, SkyUI and HDT HH system.
SKSE: [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/](http://skse.silverlock.org/)[/url]
SkyUI: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?](http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?)[/url]
HDT HH: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36213/?](http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36213/?)[/url]

The boots don't have HDT HH implemented, use custom / override options instead.
(Set height for the boots to 5.5 or close to it.

To smith these items you need steel (skill) for the Angel (white) version of
the items and ebony (skill) for the Dark Angel version.

The only real issues is some minor clipping in "unusual" positions (think pose
mod / fnis) and gloves clipping on arm in first person on naked body.
(Probably legs too but I haven't really check that).

Helmet is classified as circlet.

Wings do not move independantly, they are static.

If you wish to edit or change anything with the creationkit all my items
are named BBD... and is located under Armor/Addon and Constructible Objects.

The included readme text file have all the item ID details for those
that just wish to use player.additem command.



Video review by vatiwah:
[youtube]GCWBxc1Tat4[/youtube]



================================================================================
Installation
================================================================================
Copy the BBD_AngelVixenArmor.esp and BBD_AngelVixenArmor.bsa and place it in
the Skyrim data folder.
(C:\Program Files\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\data)
Make sure it is selected during load.
